about_the_game:
Meet Lily, an energetic young lady with a love for exploration. One boring day at school, Lily looks up at the sky and begins to ponder. "Is the moon really made of cheese?" Determined to find out, Lily sneaks out and tries her hand at some parkour using her parasol, to try to make her way up to the moon.

Look, man, I don't know either.

Help Lily make her way to the moon! There are four tough levels to overcome, each more difficult than the last. Float across deadly chasms, grapple your way through tight corridors, and make your way upwards! And for an extra challenge, you can try finding the big coins! Once you've perfected the main game, there's also an extensive cheat selection to spice things up! With its tight controls, colourful graphics and expertly-crafted levels, as well as a great soundtrack, this short yet addictive game is sure to keep you coming back for more!

This game also features a simple yet robust level editor that allows you to make your own Onward and Upward! DX challenges! Create the exact setting you wish for your level, play it through and share it with the world using Steam Workshop! From clever puzzles to devilish gauntlets, there's always something new to play!

Originally made for GBJam 11.

highlighted.name: Places to go, people to see

detailed_description:
Meet Lily, an energetic young lady with a love for exploration. One boring day at school, Lily looks up at the sky and begins to ponder. "Is the moon really made of cheese?" Determined to find out, Lily sneaks out and tries her hand at some parkour using her parasol, to try to make her way up to the moon.

Look, man, I don't know either.

Help Lily make her way to the moon! There are four tough levels to overcome, each more difficult than the last. Float across deadly chasms, grapple your way through tight corridors, and make your way upwards! And for an extra challenge, you can try finding the big coins! Once you've perfected the main game, there's also an extensive cheat selection to spice things up! With its tight controls, colourful graphics and expertly-crafted levels, as well as a great soundtrack, this short yet addictive game is sure to keep you coming back for more!

This game also features a simple yet robust level editor that allows you to make your own Onward and Upward! DX challenges! Create the exact setting you wish for your level, play it through and share it with the world using Steam Workshop! From clever puzzles to devilish gauntlets, there's always something new to play!

Originally made for GBJam 11.
legal_notice: "Input 6.1" is a Game Maker Studio 2 controller library made by Juju Adams, Alynne Keith, and friends. All rights reserved.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Any Linux version
  • Processor: Any 64-bit processor
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics
  • Storage: 30 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • Additional Notes: Game itself is very small, but more space is required for custom content.
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Anything Debian-based (Ubuntu, Linux Mint, etc.)
  • Processor: Intel Celeron N4020 or better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics or better
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • Additional Notes: To be honest, this game should run on practically any computer.

name: Onward and Upward! DX

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: Any 64-bit processor
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 30 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • Additional Notes: Game itself is very small, but more space is required for custom content.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: Intel Celeron N4020 or better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 100 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • Additional Notes: To be honest, this game should run on practically any computer.

short_description: Climb from the Earth to the Moon to try and solve an urban legend! Brave tough challenges as you float and grapple your way up to the tune of a great soundtrack! Be sure to bring a space suit, and get climbing!
